intro: [WRONG START] Rubus obscurus microgene hyosericeus, commonly known as the slender blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its erect, thorny stems and small, dark purple to black berries. The plant produces trifoliate leaves with serrated edges and white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its fruit is edible but often has a tart, sharp flavor.
